required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Coagulation Faction VIIa Variant Marzeptacog Alfa (Activated) in Adult Subjects With Hemophilia
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 1 Study to Evaluate the Pharmacokinetics, Pharmacodynamics, and Safety of Ascending Doses of Subcutaneous Marzeptacog Alfa (Activated) in Adult Subjects With Hemophilia

brief_summary.textblock: This multi-center, open label Phase 1 study will evaluate the pharmacokinetics, pharmacodynamics, and safety of a single IV dose of MarzAA followed by ascending single SC doses of MarzAA in adult subjects with moderate or severe Hemophilia A or B, with or without an inhibitor.

detailed_description.textblock: This multi-center, open label Phase 1 study will evaluate the pharmacokinetics, pharmacodynamics, and safety of a single IV dose of MarzAA followed by ascending single SC doses of MarzAA in adult subjects with moderate or severe Hemophilia A or B, with or without an inhibitor. The study will enroll at least 8 adult male subjects with moderate or severe Hemophilia A or B with or without an inhibitor, in each dosing stage. Each subject will receive escalating doses of MarzAA for each stage of the study (except for Stage 5, where subjects receive the same dose as in Stage 4 split between two anatomical sites).

primary_outcome.measure: Comparative MarzAA Activity by Dose Level/Stage - AUC0-∞ and AUC0-last
primary_outcome.time_frame: Dosing period for each stage was approximately 3 days, with a maximum of approximately 8 weeks of dosing, depending on participation in all 9 stages and time elapsed between each study stage.
primary_outcome.description: Comparative pharmacokinetics (PK) by dose level/stage based on examination of AUC frequencies of these for each of the dose groups

primary_outcome.measure: Comparative MarzAA Activity by Dose Level/Stage - AUCT1-T2 Normalized by Dose = AUC0-last/Dose
primary_outcome.time_frame: Dosing period for each stage was approximately 3 days, with a maximum of approximately 8 weeks of dosing, depending on participation in all 9 stages and time elapsed between each study stage.
primary_outcome.description: Comparative pharmacokinetics by dose level/stage based on examination of AUC frequency of these for each of the dose groups

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Dosing period for each stage was approximately 3 days, with a maximum of approximately 8 weeks of dosing, depending on participation in all 9 stages and time elapsed between each study stage.
secondary_outcome.description: Change in Cmax at each stage for each dose group

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Dosing period for each stage was approximately 3 days, with a maximum of approximately 8 weeks of dosing, depending on participation in all 9 stages and time elapsed between each study stage.
secondary_outcome.description: Change in Tmax at each stage for each dose group

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Dosing period for each stage was approximately 3 days, with a maximum of approximately 8 weeks of dosing, depending on participation in all 9 stages and time elapsed between each study stage.
secondary_outcome.description: Change in T1/2eqα at each stage for each dose group

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Dosing period for each stage was approximately 3 days, with a maximum of approximately 8 weeks of dosing, depending on participation in all 9 stages and time elapsed between each study stage.
secondary_outcome.description: Change in T1/2λ-z at each stage for each dose group

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparative MarzAA Activity of Intravenous and Subcutaneous - CL
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Dosing period for each stage was approximately 3 days, with a maximum of approximately 8 weeks of dosing, depending on participation in all 9 stages and time elapsed between each study stage.
secondary_outcome.description: Change in CL at each stage for each dose group

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparative MarzAA Activity of Intravenous and Subcutaneous - Vd1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Dosing period for each stage was approximately 3 days, with a maximum of approximately 8 weeks of dosing, depending on participation in all 9 stages and time elapsed between each study stage.
secondary_outcome.description: Change in Vd1 at each stage for each dose group

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparative MarzAA Activity of Intravenous and Subcutaneous - BAabs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Dosing period for each stage was approximately 3 days, with a maximum of approximately 8 weeks of dosing, depending on participation in all 9 stages and time elapsed between each study stage.
secondary_outcome.description: Change in BAabs at each stage for each dose group

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparative MarzAA Activity of Intravenous and Subcutaneous - Mean Residence Time
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Dosing period for each stage was approximately 3 days, with a maximum of approximately 8 weeks of dosing, depending on participation in all 9 stages and time elapsed between each study stage.
secondary_outcome.description: Change in Mean Residence Time at each stage for each dose group

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of Split Injections on MarzAA Activity by Dose Level/Stage - AUC From T1 to T2 Norm by Dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Dosing period for each stage was approximately 3 days, with a maximum of approximately 8 weeks of dosing, depending on participation in all 9 stages and time elapsed between each study stage.
secondary_outcome.description: PK analysis by route of administration, dose level/stage of the study based on examination of AUC for each of the dose groups. Split dose (2*30 µg/kg) vs. (60 µg/kg)

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of Split Injections on MarzAA Activity by Dose Level/Stage - AUC Infinity Obs and AUC to Last Nonzero Conc
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Dosing period for each stage was approximately 3 days, with a maximum of approximately 8 weeks of dosing, depending on participation in all 9 stages and time elapsed between each study stage.
secondary_outcome.description: PK analysis by route of administration, dose level/stage of the study based on examination of AUC for each of the dose groups. Split dose (2*30 µg/kg) vs. (60 µg/kg)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Coagulation Parameters - Prothrombin Time (PT)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From predose to Day 2 at stage 1 (IV). From predose to Day 3 at stages 2-7 (SC).
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum change in PT from pre-dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Coagulation Parameters - Activated Partial Thromboplastin Time (aPTT)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From predose to Day 2 at stage 1 (IV). From predose to Day 3 at stages 2-9 (SC).
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum change in aPTT from pre-dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Coagulation Parameters - Thrombin Generation Time (TGT) - TGT-Peak
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From predose to Day 2 at stage 1 (IV). From predose to Day 3 at stages 2-9 (SC).
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum change in TGT parameter from pre-dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Coagulation Parameters - Thrombin Generation Time (TGT) - TGT-Lag and TGT-Time to Peak
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From predose to Day 2 at stage 1 (IV). From predose to Day 3 at stages 2-9 (SC).
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum change in TGT parameters from pre-dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Coagulation Parameters - Thrombin Generation Time (TGT) - TGT-Endogenous Thrombin Potential
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From predose to Day 2 at stage 1 (IV). From predose to Day 3 at stages 2-9 (SC).
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum change in TGT parameter from pre-dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Thrombogenicity Parameter - Fibrinogen
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From predose to Day 2 at stage 1 (IV). From predose to Day 3 at stages 2-9 (SC).
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum change in thrombogenicity parameter from pre-dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Thrombogenicity Parameter - Prothrombin Fragments 1 + 2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From predose to Day 2 at stage 1 (IV). From predose to Day 3 at stages 2-9 (SC).
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum change in thrombogenicity parameter from pre-dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Thrombogenicity Parameter - Thrombin/Antithrombin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From predose to Day 2 at stage 1 (IV). From predose to Day 3 at stages 2-9 (SC).
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum change in thrombogenicity parameter from pre-dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Thrombogenicity Parameter - D-Dimer
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From predose to Day 2 at stage 1 (IV). From predose to Day 3 at stages 2-9 (SC).
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum change in thrombogenicity parameter from pre-dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of an Antibody Response to MarzAA
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From time of first dose of MarzAA until date of first occurrence of clinical event, assessed up to End of Study. Dosing period for each stage was approximately 3 days, with a maximum of approximately 8 weeks of dosing.
secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence of an antibody response to MarzAA and whether it is inhibitory and cross-reactive to wild-type recombinant coagulation FVII (wt-rFVII) or wt-FVIIa

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of Clinical Thrombotic Event
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of first dose of MarzAA until date of first occurrence of clinical event, assessed up to End of Study. Dosing period for each stage was approximately 3 days, with a maximum of approximately 8 weeks of dosing.
secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence of clinical thrombotic event not attributable to another cause

arm_group.description: MarzAA (Coagulation Factor VIIa variant) 18 µg/kg intravenously (Stage 1) followed by MarzAA 30 µg/kg subcutaneously (SC) (Stage 2), MarzAA 45 µg/kg SC (Stage 3), MarzAA 60 µg/kg SC (Stage 4), MarzAA 2x30 µg/kg SC (Stage 5), MarzAA 90 µg/kg SC (Stage 6), MarzAA 120 µg/kg SC (Stage 7), MarzAA 2×60 µg/kg SC (Stage 8), MarzAA 3x60 µg/kg SC (Stage 9)

intervention.description: Single intravenous dose and ascending doses of subcutaneous injection of MarzAA (Coagulation Faction VIIa Variant)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Moderate or severe congenital Hemophilia A or B, with or without an inhibitor
- Male, age 18 or older
- Affirmation of informed consent with signature confirmation before any trial related activities
Exclusion Criteria:
- Inability to discontinue and washout prophylaxis treatment 72 hours prior to dosing.
- Previous participation in a trial involving SC Administration of rFVIIa or any trial using a modified amino-acid sequence FVIIa
- Known positive antibody to FVII or FVIIa detected by central laboratory at screening
- Have a coagulation disorder other than hemophilia A or B, with or without an inhibitor
- Significant contraindication to participate

facility.name: Specialized Hospital for Active Treatment of Hematological Diseases
Kirov Research Institute of Hematology and Blood Transfusion
Municipal Policlinic # 37, City Center for Hemophilia Treatment

patient_data.ipd_description: This is an open label study so each investigator will have full access to all study subject data that is entered into the database.

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Fourteen subjects were screened in the study and three subjects were screen failures. Two subjects failed due to having a known positive antibody at screening, and one subject failed screening due to other.

group.title: Overall Study Population
group.description: Coagulation Factor VIIa variant: Single intravenous dose and ascending doses of subcutaneous injection of MarzAA

period.title: Stage 8: MarzAA 2 x 60 µg/kg Q3H SC
Stage 9: MarzAA 3 x 60 µg/kg Q3H SC

outcome.title: Effect of Split Injections on MarzAA Activity by Dose Level/Stage - AUC From T1 to T2 Norm by Dose
outcome.description: PK analysis by route of administration, dose level/stage of the study based on examination of AUC for each of the dose groups. Split dose (2*30 µg/kg) vs. (60 µg/kg)
outcome.time_frame: Dosing period for each stage was approximately 3 days, with a maximum of approximately 8 weeks of dosing, depending on participation in all 9 stages and time elapsed between each study stage.

outcome.title: Occurrence of an Antibody Response to MarzAA
outcome.description: Occurrence of an antibody response to MarzAA and whether it is inhibitory and cross-reactive to wild-type recombinant coagulation FVII (wt-rFVII) or wt-FVIIa
outcome.time_frame: From time of first dose of MarzAA until date of first occurrence of clinical event, assessed up to End of Study. Dosing period for each stage was approximately 3 days, with a maximum of approximately 8 weeks of dosing.

reported_events.time_frame: Treatment-emergent adverse events were defined as any event that either began or worsened after the first administration of study drug and within 28 days of the last dose.
reported_events.desc: An adverse event (AE) was any untoward medical occurrence associated with the use of a drug in humans, whether or not considered drug-related. An AE was any unfavorable and unintended sign, symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of a drug, without any judgment about causality. An AE could arise from any use of the drug (eg, off label use, use in combination with another drug) and from any route of administration, formulation, or dose, including an overdose.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
